wikipedia_page.main:
William Harris (17 June 1864 – 18 June 1949) was an English cricketer.  Harris was a right-handed batsman who bowled right-arm off break.  He was born in Kimberley, Nottinghamshire.
Harris played a single first-class match for Nottinghamshire against Sussex in 1886 at the County Ground, Hove.  In his only first-class match he scored 2 runs in his only innings, leaving him with a batting average of 2.00.He died at Crofton Park, London on 18 June 1949.
